column4: Is there a way to run a script automatically every time you log in?
what do you want to accomplish?
I want to run xrandr to setup dual head display
it's really simple, just a 2-line script, but I'm tired of running it manually every time I log in
so you want to run the script before the graphical interface kicks in
Ideally I want to run it after the xserver starts, but before the window manager starts.
but even running it after the WM is fine too
the simplest way to accomplish this is to put the script in /etc/X11/Xsession.d
so I just copy it over to there and it will run automatically?
it does on debian, i'm not sure if it works for ubuntu
you can give it a shot though, don't forget to chmod +x the script
okay thanks, I'll give it a try :-)
it didn't work out for you?
I tried copying the script to /etc/X11/Xsession.d/, but that didn't work
I'm wondering if those scripts are executed at all
